CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this area chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing GeoHeat Commodity relative to TerraFuel Exchange?
SRP.A: GeoHeat Commodity is {below} TerraFuel Exchange in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total natural gas prices?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {GeoHeat Commodity}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total natural gas prices?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Lumina Energy Market}.

VE.Q: What is Zephyr Gas Index's Natural Gas Prices in 1973?
VE.A: Zephyr Gas Index's natural gas prices in 1973 is {1.52} $/cubic meter.

VE.Q: What is TerraFuel Exchange's Natural Gas Prices in 1967?
VE.A: TerraFuel Exchange's natural gas prices in 1967 is {2.36} $/cubic meter.

VE.Q: What is AquaSource Trading's Natural Gas Prices in 1985?
VE.A: AquaSource Trading's natural gas prices in 1985 is {2.01} $/cubic meter.

VE.Q: What are the natural gas prices of SkyFlow Water Index, Lumina Energy Market, and GeoHeat Commodity in 1970?
VE.A: SkyFlow Water Index's natural gas prices is {1.68} $/cubic meter, Lumina Energy Market's natural gas prices is {1.33} $/cubic meter, GeoHeat Commodity's natural gas prices is {2.73} $/cubic meter.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum Natural Gas Prices in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum natural gas prices is {0.02} $/cubic meter.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum Natural Gas Prices in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global maximum natural gas prices is {5.22} $/cubic meter.

EVJ.Q: What is the highest Natural Gas Prices level recorded for AquaSource Trading?
EVJ.A: AquaSource Trading reached approximately {2.51} $/cubic meter in {1966}.

EVJ.Q: What is the lowest Natural Gas Prices level recorded for AquaSource Trading?
EVJ.A: AquaSource Trading's lowest recorded level is approximately {1.50} $/cubic meter in {1969}.

SC.Q: What is the average total Natural Gas Prices?
SC.A: The average total natural gas prices is {14.21} $/cubic meter.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Natural Gas Prices exceed 14.79 $/cubic meter? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {15.42} $/cubic meter in {1981}, {15.03} $/cubic meter in {1976}, {15.17} $/cubic meter in {1971}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Natural Gas Prices fall between 13.52 and 14.95 $/cubic meter? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {13.97} $/cubic meter in {1970}, {14.86} $/cubic meter in {1982}, {14.10} $/cubic meter in {1980}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Natural Gas Prices go below 13.68 $/cubic meter? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {13.61} $/cubic meter in {1968}, {13.06} $/cubic meter in {1974}, {13.06} $/cubic meter in {1969}.

NC.Q: Between 1975 and 1981, was the average total Natural Gas Prices higher or lower than between 1968 and 1969?
NC.A: The average total natural gas prices between 1975 and 1981 was {higher} than between 1968 and 1969.

NC.Q: Was the total Natural Gas Prices in 1966 higher or lower than in 1977?
NC.A: The total natural gas prices in 1966 was {higher} than in 1977.

NC.Q: Was the total Natural Gas Prices in 1972 higher or lower than in 1973?
NC.A: The total natural gas prices in 1972 was {higher} than in 1973.

NC.Q: Between 1970 and 1976, did the total Natural Gas Prices experience a larger or smaller change than between 1969 and 1984?
NC.A: The change in total natural gas prices between 1970 and 1976 was {larger} than between 1969 and 1984.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {GeoHeat Commodity} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Lumina Energy Market, SkyFlow Water Index, Zephyr Gas Index, TerraFuel Exchange, AquaSource Trading, Solara Power Futures, GeoHeat Commodity}.
